channel.title: HELP! I wanna make an rsps on my mac but don't know how!
channel.description:
HELP! I wanna make an rsps on my mac but don't know how!
i wanna make a 317 server on my mac... Can someone plz TeamView with me?
[u][i][b]p.s: i have made many 317 rsps' before on a windows computer but i got a new mac about 2 weeks ago and don't know how to make one on it.[/b][/i][/u]

item.title: HELP! I wanna make an rsps on my mac but don't know how!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You should be able to just use ‘java CLASS’ like any other OS, as long as it’s installed correctly.

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! I wanna make an rsps on my mac but don't know how!

item.title: HELP! I wanna make an rsps on my mac but don't know how!
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

have you tried this on your mac (THIS WORKS FOR CLIENT)
need tut found video here http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FfKCjtGvDzo&feature=related
step 1: open up terminal (you can find it in spotlight)
step 2: in terminal type cd then press the space bar
step 3: drag the client folder into terminal then press enter
step 4: edit the client run.bat with textedit then copy all of that into terminal

IDK ABOUT SOURCE BUT YOU CODE TRY IT INSTEAD OF PUTTING CLIENT FOLDER TRY SOURCE FOLDER & RUN.BAT CODE

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! I wanna make an rsps on my mac but don't know how!

item.title: HELP! I wanna make an rsps on my mac but don't know how!
item.dc:creator: @mrpopyman mrpopyman
item.description:
@mrpopyman wrote:

ultimatepkvillage:

portforward on your mac with your router

i’ve done all the port-forwarding and stuff, i just wanna know how to run .bat files!

Read full topic

item.title: HELP! I wanna make an rsps on my mac but don't know how!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“mrpopyman, post:3, topic:425462”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=528127.msg3850972#msg3850972 date=1324005265]
That’s what happens when buying such piece of crap,
mac is for hipsters, not for developers

and
http://lmgtfy.com/?q=how+to+run+an+rsps+on+mac[/quote]

I have searched that millions of times but none of it is of any use.

Can someone plz help me?!@!?#

P.S. MAC IS NOT CRAP!
P.S.S. If i hadn’t searched it up on google first do you think i would have come in in the first place? Moparscape.org has always been my fallback help site.[/quote]

Then you would know that most RS2 Server Emulators are written in Java, which is a platform-independent language, and the process is identical on Windows, Mac, Linux, SPARC, etc.

Read full topic
